fields.description: Create a portlet which displays an RSS feed. The portlet would take a two parameters - the RSS URL and the amount of time to cache the results for.
fields.summary: RSS portlet

fields.description:
Currently the Browse Project UI is a bit out of touch. It could be greatly improved:
- make it look more like the other pages (task driven UI)
- remove project stats from all pages
- display reports and statistics (like Open Issues report) for individual components and versions.
fields.summary: Improve the UI for browse project
Improve Listeners to be configurable objects

fields.description:
Users have asked to reorder the fields that are displayed in the create and edit issue forms.

A simple administration page should contain a single select box, with reorder functions (like reschedule versions). 

This page should reorder default fields (only shown fields) and custom fields.
fields.summary: Reorder fields

fields.description:
The upgrade process for the webapp distribution (described in readme.txt) suggests that the distribution be unpacked in the same directory as the old JIRA install.  The webapp/ directory will then be overwritten, and when 'ant war' is run, the customized files in edit-webapp/ are copied over webapp/.

This is not safe, since unused files from old versions (specifically old jars) can cause conflicts in the new version.

Solutions, in order of preference:

1) JIRA webapp root directory should be 'jira-<version>' instead of just  'webapp'.  Then, if the user unpacks to c:\jira, after a few versions one would have:

c:\jira\jira-1.4
c:\jira\jira-2.0.2
c:\jira\jira-2.1
c:\jira\edit-webapp

With edit-webapp/ contents overwriting each one in the usual manner.

2) Edit the docs to describe an equivalent process: unpack to a separate directory, then copy across one's edit-webapp/ directory.


--Jeff
fields.summary: Suggested upgrade process leaves old files that can cause problems

fields.description:
We should investigate the possibility of using nice DHTML floating divs for various UI functions within JIRA, like:
- history list (popup on every page as a div)
- list of filters (could then be on every page, with the current filter highlighted)
- linked issue mouseover (could popup a whole div with summary info, icons etc)

We need to improve our code to only produce these divs if the remote browser supports it.
fields.summary: Investigate DHTML / floating divs for UI

fields.description:
Hello!

I am evaluating JIRA for our company.
I've got only one problem for now and hope that it is not too serious :-).

When I am exporting table with issues from JIRA to Excel format, I'm getting all national (actually Russian, e.g. Cyrillic, in Windows are represented by 1251 codepage) characters replaced by question mark "?".
I've also took a brief look to an XML export and found that similar encoding error may be found there too.
I am attaching the sample of an XML export to the end of this issue.
I've also typed one word in cyrillic to the subject of this issue report. This word should look like "pycckue" if everything is OK.

I would be very gratefull for any kind of workaround or solution for this problem. Frankly speaking, for this day JIRA seems to be best choice for us, but we need XLS export very much.

Thanks in advance,
Andrey Khapugin,
Excelsior

fields.description:
OK, we want a very simple time tracking report. Obviously this report only shows up if time tracking is turned on.

The report is access from the BrowseProject page, and generated after the following form:
- select a single version
- select the option to show most or least finished first
- select option to show all issues or only uncompleted issues

After submitting, the report is displayed.

Report should show a simple bar graph of completion (ie 25 hours of 4 days total completed) in graphical and text format.

Under that, display the list of issues (as per the options selected above). The list should show 8 columns - issue key, status, priority, summary, time spent, current estimate, original estimate, and time left.
fields.summary: Simple time tracking report

fields.description:

I think "then" should be "the"

I flushed my browser Cache and that didn't help.

I choose the Re-Index option, which was successful, and that didn't help.

Also put it into the body of the text and HTML mails somehow.
fields.summary: Show issue count in subscription email

fields.description:
On the Personal Road Map (/secure/BrowsePersonalProject.jspa), the list of projects is in a single column that is the width of the entire screen. We have a lot of projects in the system, and as such this project box becomes quite long.

What about displaying the list of project names in two columns, so it fits a little more nicely without taking up so much space?
fields.summary: Two-column project display on Personal Road Map

It would be great if user could specify what type of work was he doing in Log Work.
fields.summary: Add type of work in Log work

Frank,

Cheers,
Scott

Frank Gainley wrote:
Hi Scott,

I am running:
JIRA 2.0.2 (WAR/EAR installation)
Windows 2000
SQL server 2000
Tomcat 4.1.24
Java 1.4.1
 
We are going to create a separate project for each software product that is developed in-house.  In addtion, we would like to run our internal help desk using JIRA.
 
For the help desk application, I have created a new Project called "IT Services", and a new Issue Type called "ITS Ticket".  When I select "IT Services" from the Project dropdown list, is there any way to create an association so that only "ITS Ticket" appears as an Issue Type?  In this case, Bug, New Feature, Task, and Improvement would not be valid selections for the "IT Services" project.  Conversely, "ITS Ticket" would not be a valid selection for the projects associated with software products that are developed in-house.
fields.summary: Association between Project and Issue Type based upon Project selection?

fields.description:
When creating a new project, the notification, permission and issue security schemes should probably default to "Default X scheme" instead of "none".

--Jeff

issue type workflow definition

fields.description:
I currently have a filter that I want my testers to use during a particular stage of the test cycle for any given project.  But, while the filter is valid for any project it should only be run on one project at any one time.

Currently, Jira requires that the project be specified in the filter or that the filter runs on every project.  Rather than recreate this filter for every project, I have left the project unspecified.  This requires that the testers wun the filter twice:  once to get to the filter and a second time after setting the project.

This isn't a major problem but it would be nice if, when creating the filter, it was possible to specify that the filter should request a project before running.  Alternatively, if the filter culd be added to the "Preset Filters" portion of the project information/browsing area, the user would not need to be asked as the project would be specified by the link chosen by the user.
fields.summary: "Ask for project" option in saved filters

It would be beneficial to have a custom field type user or group. You could input a JIRA username or groupname and have a link created to the user information. 

Filters could then be setup similarly as for reported by and assignee fields.

We would use this for custom fields like: Originally Reported by or Request taken by (if reported by could be edited by the user, see JRA-761)

fields.description: In the portlet that lists "Open Issues: Assigned To Me", issues that were previously resolved but have been reopened do not appear.
fields.summary: Reopened issues do not appear in "Assigned to me" portlet

fields.description:
Let's face it, developers are not going to remember to select "Leave existing estimate of" every time.  They will use the default, "Auto adjust", no matter what you say they should use, because they will forget.

As long as the "Total Time Spent" (TTS) is less than the original estimate, you can reconstruct the original estimate by adding the TTS and "Estimated Time Remaining" (ETR).  But as soon as you log more time than you originally estimated, the ETR becomes fixed at 0, and the original estimate is lost entirely.  This means you lose all track of your original estimate at the time when you need it most, when you've gone over.

I can see three ways to fix this:
1. Allow the ETR to go negative.
2. Change the default to "Leave existing estimate of".
3. Allow the system administrator to configure the default.

The first two options would be quite simple; the third would require some design.

(In case I haven't mentioned it recently, I really think this is a great product, despite my specific complaints.)
fields.summary: Original time estimate is lost

fields.description:
Nitpick: The title on the Send Test E-mail page, available off the "Mail Servers" administration page, is incorrect.  It says "Welcome - JIRA Instance Name".  It should probably say "Send Test E-mail - JIRA Instance Name".

/secure/admin/SendTestMail.jspa

fields.description:
EmailHandlers should add attachments in emails to Jira issues. Otherwise the attachments will be totally lost when the email is removed from the mailbox. This is not acceptable behaviour. 

Both comment handlers and create issue handler should be able to create attachments.
fields.summary: Add attachment support to EmailHandlers

fields.description: Help links should point to new location.
fields.summary: Upgrade JIRA Help icons to point to new locations

fields.description: When a new users installs Jira they should be given the option to install a backup service for their data.
fields.summary: Setup should have a backup creation option

fields.description:
Upgrade JIRA Message handlers:

- Add CreateOrCommentHandler
- Modify CreateHandler & CommentHandler to handle attachments
fields.summary: Improve Message Handlers

fields.description:
Since customers pay for new features, and improvements, our PMs always set a 'Estimated time' when creating issues.
But developers are not forced to log work done when they resolve or close an issue. I think there should be the feature for administrators to force their users to log work done for certain projects, otherwise the estimated time feature could result unusable.
fields.summary: "Log work done" as a MANDATORY field when resolving issues

fields.description:
It could be useful for project managers to have a "shared download place" for each project, in order to mantain project docs (such as technical specs, and all related documents) always up to date and available for developers.

Each doc could have a set of metadata such as version, creation date, category etc. and maybe the creation of "subfolders" could be nice.
 
Project managers could also refer an issue to an available online document in Jira rather than upload the same document each time a new issue is created.
fields.summary: Project documentation

fields.description:
It could be useful to have the choice to automatically close issues that are marked as "resolved" when releasing a version, or after a period of time in a "resolved" status, or anyway to have a "batch" function to close a group of issues all at once.
Actually, we're forced to manually close them one by one.
What do you think about it? :)
fields.summary: Automatically close resolved issues when releasing a version

fields.description:
Currently JIRA EmailHandlers, except CreateIssueHandler delete all emails in a POP mailbox, regardless of whether it has been able to add emails to issue comments. 

Modify (or add parameter to choose) EmailHandler to:
1. delete emails always (current setup)
2. delete only recognized and successfully processed emails (like CreateIssueHandler)
fields.summary: EmailHandlers should delete emails from Mailbox only if email is added to JIRA

fields.description:
Currently CreateIssueHandler accepts only configurations for email recipient. 

It would be good if one could also configure CreateIssueHandler to route emails to new issues in projects based on email sender. 

We have multiple customer support projects in JIRA Pro and I would like to use only one email address (support@domain.com) for all communication with customers. This feature is needed to route new issue emails to correct projects based on email sender domain information.
fields.summary: CreateIssueHandler should be able to create issues based on email sender

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1739].
  {panel}

It would be great if we could create multiple SMTP server configurations with atleast different from configurationsa and then be able to attach an SMTP server to a notification scheme. 

These would enable, together with an EmailHander service, one to create projects with separate email addresses that would be completely integrated to JIRA.

For example:
One customer support project sends emails out as support@domain.com. JIRA EmailHandler listens to this box and creates comments from incoming email.

An internal helpdesk project could then be created that sends out emails as helpdesk@domain.com. JIRA EmailHandler could listen to this box and create comments from incoming email. 

CreateIssueHandler would then be easier to configure since both projects have totally separate email addresses. No user needs to remember two email addresses to comment or create issues.
fields.summary: Allow Notification Schemes to be linked to separate SMTP servers

fields.description:
Clicking on Excel view gives the error message:


Microsoft Excel cannot access the file 'https://sdev.sil.org/sdev/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?view=excel&tempMax=1000'. There are several possible reasons:

? The file name or path name does not exist.
? The file you're trying to open is being used by another program. Close the document in the other program, and try again.
? The name of the workbook you're trying to save is the same as the name of another document that is read-only. Try saving the workbook with a different name.
fields.summary: Excel export over https doesn't work

fields.description:
Under one user account, when the user logs in the page is blank.  If you try to edit the dashboard of that user, the application crashes and reports the following:

HTTP Status 500 - Passed List had more than one value.


type Status report


message Passed List had more than one value.


description The server encountered an internal error (Passed List had more than one value.) that prevented it from fulfilling this request.


Apache Tomcat/4.1.24
fields.summary: Error on edit Dashboard configuration / Dashboard page is empty

fields.description: Summary says it all really - on the viewIssue page, theres hyperlinks for the project, and it would be handy having a similiar links for each component.
fields.summary: Provide hyperlink to components on viewIssue.jspa as with project hyperlinks.

fields.description: I went to attach an 8.5 MB File and I got an error referencing the Content Length, which I understand.  What i thought was cool was what the error looked like.  I am going to attach it.  This was obviously for an existing issue that had a reporter and was assigned.
fields.summary: Attachment Error

fields.description:
After switching on Time Tracking, the text says:

  "For the users you wish to be able to log work on issues, ensure that they have the Work On Issues permission, either globally or for a particular project."

I think that is out of date, with time tracking having migrated from global permissions to permission schemes.

--Jeff
fields.summary: Incorrect text when activating time tracking

fields.description: We need the capability to switch issue from project to project. For example,  currently we record our customer issues in one projects.  For those issues that we agree we want to fix, we need the ability to either switch project assignment (in this case to a development project) or to easily duplicate and link the defect to another project.  We currently perform the linking but must manually reenter the issue in the new project.
fields.summary: Allow issues to change project assignment

fields.description:
Recently I got a request to enable JIRA to create new issues from e-mail. I tried to install CreateIssueHandler as described at http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=2704&messageID=50917386#50917386

I completed all 11 steps and got this error message in JIRA log:
----
2003-05-19 14:40:00,648 ERROR [service.services.file.AbstractMessageHandlingServ
ice] You must specify a valid handler class for this Service.
2003-05-19 14:40:00,777 ERROR [service.services.file.AbstractMessageHandlingServ
ice] You must specify a valid handler class for this Service.
----
I don't know how could the handler class be incorrect, as it was selected from a combo box. I also have no idea why this error was logged twice.

My service configuration:
----
service class: com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService handler class: com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.CreateIssueHandler
handler.params: project=PPM, issuetype=3
popserver: 10010
delay (mins):  1
----
fields.summary: create issue from email - invalid handler

fields.description: When running Jira (standalone) using a different port than the default (8080), the generated emails stil list 8080 in the URLs.  This effectively breaks all links in the emails.
fields.summary: Emails from Jira list port incorrectly
Batch notifications into single e-mail

fields.description: It would be nice to have date when version was released.
fields.summary: Date whene version was released

fields.description:
I added a custom field with the type "select list". This new field comes
> while creating an issue but not resolving it. But I want to see and set it
> while resolving the issue. I made this because  I want to classify issues
> according to their cause(some fix causes). Is it possible to see the custom
> fields in resolution step or is it possible to classify the issues
> according to their causes?
fields.summary: root cause classifiy

fields.description:
- Filter: select more than one Resolution
- Show
- Sort i.e. by Status

fields.summary: Filter changed after sorting issues

fields.description:
When I receive an HTML email, and I click the View Online link in the upper left corner, and if i have a linked issue, this is the href that is associated for the linked task:

http://www.yoururlhere.net:8080/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=ISSUEKEY-36;jsessionid=2090E7E2DCFE99B20BA184E731E0D4CA

The part that makes this a bad link is the jsessionid.  If i click on the linked issue i get an error page.  If i hit the back button on the Browser (IE 6.0 SP1), and then click on the linked issue again it works fine.  This only happens the first time through when clicking on the view online from an email.
fields.summary: Linked Issue has bad href
Current Version

fields.description:
The Web documentation:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/servers/tomcat41.jsp

is out of date with Jira 2.0.2

Specifically: 
"Build JIRA using 'ant generic'. This will produce the WAR to deploy at dist/atlassian-jira-web.war."

- There is no "generic" target in the latest build.xml
- It builds dist/atlassian-jira-2.0.2.war

-Nick
fields.summary: Installation documentation on Web is slightly out of date

Having clicked "Log work done" in the bottom-right of an issue, one of the options is "Leave existing estimate of".  Seems like a value wasn't filled in there.  See attached screenshot.

--Jeff
fields.summary: When logging work, "leave existing estimate" broken

fields.description:
If an Administrator is viewing a project:(ala ViewProject.jspa?pid=10432), and another administrator deletes it, then the first Administrator doesnt get a "Project does not exist" error - just a strange Project view with all project data missing.

Put another way, you can put ViewProject.jspa?pid=10432999919919292 (any random number) and not get an error.

-Nick

fields.description:
If two administrators happen to delete the same user (possible due to the confirm step in between), the second delete throws up an invalid error message.


"
Delete User: mruser

This user cannot be deleted at this time because there are issues assigned to them, or they have reported issues. 

Form Errors: 
Exception validating data: java.lang.NullPointerException
"

fields.description:
com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.user.DeleteUser.java:32

addErrorMessage("Cannot delete user " + name + ", " + getReportedIssues().size() + " issues were reporter by this person.");


"reporter" should be "reported" :-0

Too much spare time I hear you ask?

-Nick

When saving the change log for description, save a diff
Bill As for work log

fields.description: I would like to suggest a new feature that would allow you to configure customized fields that are only displayed if the value of another customized field is selected in it's drop down box.
fields.summary: Hide customized fields based on the values of previous customized fields

fields.description: I would like to request a new feature.  Cascading drop downs is a critcal feature for our organization and we plan on waiting to evaluate JIRA until such features are implemented.   We track a lot of metrics related to our code development cycle.  In particular we like to associate a bug/issue to the specific screen element.  To do this we would like to be able to define two customized drop down fields where by the values in the 2nd field are filtered by the value selected in the first field.
fields.summary: Cascading Drop Down Customized Fields

fields.description: When you select multiple components for an issue, in the web interface they are separated by a comma, in the email they aren't.
fields.summary: Comma is missing from multiple components in email

fields.description:
Same circumstances as JRA-1619, different error.

I created a new group and searched on it.  It returned only a very small subset of issues assigned to members of the group.

We cannot identify any common features in the issues that are returned vs. issues that are not returned.

Likewise, we cannot identify any relevant differences between the new group that fails and older groups that work.  We even changed the permissions of the new group to match the permissions of an existing group that works, but it didn't help.

This is Critical priority for us (although I followed the documentation and only listed it as Major).  We need to be able to filter for issues that are assigned to developers in our geographic location, or other specific groups.
fields.summary: Incorrect search results from newly created group

fields.description: Start & End Time appear to be reversed for Workflow.
fields.summary: Start & End Time appear to be reversed for Workflow

fields.description:
From email:

-----------
I have created two tickets in a project and searched on them.  The titles of both had upper three letter upper case words in them (SCO and VRU).  When I searched on VRU, the ticket was found.  When I searched on VR*, no ticket was found.  When I searched on VR? A null pointer error was reported in the browser.  I verified this behavior on both VRU and SCO, as well as with MS !E and Modzilla.
-----------

Verified by Scott on 2.0.2.
fields.summary: Free text search issues

fields.description:
Non-absolute URLs don't work on Opera.  This is a combination of an Orion bug, and Opera's strict handling of the servlet spec.


Fowarded email containing more info:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've got an answer from Opera which indicates that you should be home free if you correct your
Content-Location Header. It is actually Mozilla and IE that is wrong

See the message below.

/max

Why is it that on

>   http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/secure/Dashboard.jspa
>
> the link "ALL" has a relative link to "IssueNavigator.jspa" in the source, but Opera 7 resolves it to:
>
> http://opensource.atlassian.com/secure/views/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10000
>
> Which is of course wrong.  Opera 6 doesn't do this.
>
> It should be
>
> http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/secure/IssueNavigator?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10000
>
> Mozilla and IE resovles it correctly - so what's wrong here ?
>
> The folks behind JIRA has been informed about this and are probably going to change their JIRA impl. to handle this for Opera 7 clients, but
> isn't this a bug in Opera that needs fixing preetty damn soon  ?




They are sending a Content-Location header

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Tue, 06 May 2003 16:11:22 GMT
Server: Orion/1.6.0
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=**********; Path=/
Connection: Keep-Alive
Keep-Alive: timeout=15, max=100
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store,  must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
Content-Location: /secure/views/dashboard.jsp
Transfer-Encoding: chunked


which imply that the Base URL is based on

http://opensource.atlassian.com/secure/views/dashboard.jsp

not
http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/secure/Dashboard.jspa

Which is the behaviour described in RFC 2616 sec 14.14 :

"The value of Content-Location also defines the base URI for the
entity."

Opera 7 uses this value if it is present and no Base URL declaration
is made in the document.

IOW: This is not a bug, it is a feature.

BTW: What is so sensitive about that page that they have to use a
"no-store" Cache directive to force the client to use RAM cache? 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Orion Bug:
  http://bugs.orionserver.com/issue/view.jsp?id=1083

This should be resolved by adding a base URL tag, or making all links absolute.
fields.summary: Make all links absolute to JIRA root

fields.description:
We have been experiencing some strange problems after running Bugzilla imports.  After the import, if we delete some of the projects brought over, we end up with Issues linked to non-existant components ids in nodeassociation.  We suspected that some of the issues must have been linked to components that were in other projects.

To confirm we reran the import and then ran this query:

SELECT j.pkey, j.project, c.project, c.cname, n.association_type, n.source_node_entity, n.sink_node_entity
FROM jiraissue j, nodeassociation n, component c
WHERE j.id = n.source_node_id
AND n.sink_node_id = c.id
AND c.project != j.project

And yes indeed, there were a whole bunch of IssueComponent links that appear to be cross-project, as well as IssueVersion links.  For example:

1	STEL-1	10068	10021	Drafts	IssueVersion	Issue	Version
2	STEL-1	10068	10071	Applet	IssueComponent	Issue	Component

We are now looking at the source code of com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.BugzillaImport to see if we can find the problem.
fields.summary: Bugzilla import creates cross-project Issue/Component associations
